line.en: 'Hey there, Akari.'
'Hello, Kanako. You're in an awfully good mood.'
'Heh heh! Just a tad. A new person has moved into\nthe dormitory.'
'Is that at the place where Aoi Minase is working\nas the dorm mother, that dormitory of impurity?'
'That's right, that highly dubious dormitory.'
'She's a really sweet girl. I was worried that I\nmay not be able to make friends with her,\nthough.'
'But she finally opened up, it seems.'
'...Hmm. You're unexpectedly good at looking\nafter others, aren't you?'
'How about you? It seemed like you're getting\nreally fired up about the student council.'
'There are many problems, but we're dealing with\nthem one at a time. The biggest of those problems\nis...'
'The Soaring Club?'
'Yes.'
'Geez, Mochizuki-senpai has left, so they\nshould've just started doing something else...'
'You say that, but you've been showing them a lot\nof support.'
'I am not.'
'I'm always fair, that's all.'
'Hmm. Even though the teachers aren't fair at\nall.'
'Say, that new girl has joined the Soaring\nClub... Oh, there she is now.'
'Hey, Asa!'
'Huh? Hello, Kanako!'
'...Hello.'
'What are you up to?'
'I'm looking for Aoi and the others. I want to\ntalk to them about the club's activities.'
'Aoi...? Club activities...?'
'I see, I see. Good luck!'
'OK. Well then...'
'Kanako's pretty isn't she?'
'Really? I guess she's above average.'
'Ha ha ha, I'm kinda cute, right?'
'Hey, Kanako... Those two, are they by any\nchance...'
'Yes, the Kazato sisters who joined this year.\nThey're the chairman's granddaughters, you know.'
'I thought so! That Aoi Minase... In order to\ndefy Tobioka-sensei, he's trying to get the\nchairman on his side!'
'No, that's not what this is about.'
'Just as I thought, he's pretty cunning.'
'Squeeze!'
'Eeek! Why are you hugging me all of a sudden?'
'I couldn't help it, you're so cute when you get\nall fired up when talking about Aoi!'
'What are you talking about? Let go of me!'
'No, I don't wanna!'
'This is sexual harassment!'
'Aoi!'
At lunchtime, as I was eating my lunch, Asa came\ninto the classroom.
Kotori and Ageha were with the girls, while I was\neating with some of the boys I get along with.
The boys suddenly got excited when they saw Asa.
'Who is that cute girl!? Is she another one of\nyour acquaintances!!?'
'Of course, you can see that.'
If she wasn't, she wouldn't start calling my name\nall of a sudden.
'What the hell, man! Why is it always you?'
For the time being, I push past all those\nannoying guys, then go over to Asa who is waiting\nat the door.
'Hey, Asa. What's up?'
'Umm, ahh...'
She blushes when she realizes that the older\nstudents are looking at her.
'It's about... today's club activities.'
'What's all that about?'
Kotori calls out from her seat.
'Oh, Kotori, Ageha, hello!'
She politely bows her head to them.
'You don't have to stand over there, come on in.'
Ageha beckons her over, and Asa fearfully steps\ninto the classroom.
She's nervous about going into the classroom of\nolder students.
'E-...Excuse me...'
Yoru appeared from behind the door, and followed\nAsa just like a shadow.
Speaking of which, was Yoru there before?
'(Whatever they do, wherever they go, they're\nalways together...)'
Now it's the group of girls' turn to make a fuss.
'They're twins! How cute!'
'Hey, who are they? How do you know them?'
'Ha ha ha, they are our juniors!'
Kotori seems to be boasting, almost as if to say,\n'I'm the one raised them!
Even though she only met them recently.
'Nice to meet you, I'm Asa Kazato...!'
Once again, Asa bows politely and introduces\nherself.
She's quite shy, but she does these kinds of\nthings properly.
On the contrary, her sister...
With a sullen attitude, she looks away with a\nlook of complete disinterest on her face.
In other words, this has nothing to do with her.
'She's a boarder at Kotori's place. Now, she's a\nmember of the Soaring Society.'
Asa blushes in embarrassment as Ageha introduces\nher as a member.
The girls call out, 'She's so cute!', when they\nsee these mannerisms. They certainly are cute.
'Hey, have you eaten your lunch already?'
'No, not yet. I thought I would go and eat my\nlunch with Yoru...'
She showed the lunchbox that she had brought with\nher.
'C'mon, let's eat together! OK, it's been\ndecided!'
Kotori forcefully makes the decision for her.
Asa is alright with it, but...
'Yoru, why don't you eat with us too?'
'...I don't really mind, I guess.'
Yoru accepted the offer too, with a reluctant\nexpression.
The group of girls became noisy and excited to\nsee the pretty twins, who were just like a pair\nof dolls.
'Damn you, Aoi...!'
Correction, the boys were the same.
'You mind if you leave first?'
'Why? Aren't you going to eat with us?'
'No, it's OK. Asa came here because she had\nsomething to talk about.'
'Y-...Yes, that's right! Sorry, I've been so\nthoughtless...'
'...Today's club activities, will take place over\nthere, right?'
When she means 'over there', she means the secret\nbase that she told us about a few days ago.
'That's correct.'
the leader answers.
'OK, here you are.'
Asa handed Kotori a key.
'I had a duplicate key made.'
'Is it really OK for us to come and go as we\nplease?'
As expected, even Kotori has her reservations.
'Yes, we don't mind. I got permission from\nGrandpa too.'
'Thank you, Asa!'
'...Hmph.'
After school, we moved the glider to the new\nbase.
We took the necessary tools with us, and made the\npreparations that would allow us to start\nworking.
'It's just like a secret base!'
'That expression fits it perfectly.'
'It's like being kids again. I feel really\nexcited about it!'
said Ageha, in a good mood, as she got to work.
It's true, this place feels a lot like the\n'secret base' that we made when we were little\nkids.
This dock, constructed from steel, is just how we\npictured a secret base back then.
Instead of a spaceship, or a robot, there is a\nglider.
This is our secret weapon.
'Woah... I feel really motivated!'
'Cough, cough! There's so much dust!'
'...It hasn't been cleaned at all.'
'This looks like a tough job. First, we have to\ndust it, then give everything a wipe down...'
In this room, the cleaning was already underway.
There's electricity, and if we cleaned it, we'd\nbe able to stay here overnight.
'I might go back to the dormitory and get the\nvacuum cleaner.'
'That might be the best thing to do...'
Kotori answers as she winces from dust going into\nher face.
'What's Yoru doing today?'
I was under the impression that the Kazato\nsisters were always together, but today, Yoru\nisn't here.
'She had something to do...'
'Could it be that she's angry? It seems she was\nagainst you letting us use this place.'
'Yeah...'
As Asa's expression darkened, a short tone came\nfrom her cell phone. It was a text.
'It's from Yoru.'
'I've taken something important from you -- from\nY the Thief.'
'There's an image attached, whatever could it\nbe?'
Taking an interest, Kotori and I take a look at\nher phone.
'Hmm? What's this? ...Some sort of stripy\npattern?'
'I don't know...'
At first, we couldn't tell what it was a picture\nof.
There was something that looked like human skin,\na triangle of fabric... and something stripy.
'Eek!'
'Th...these are my favorite stripy panties...'
'What!!?'
They were pink stripy panties, but it seems that\nYoru was wearing them and had lifted up her skirt\nto take the picture.
In other words, this was a view of underneath\nYoru's skirt!
Asa went stiff as a board as she looked at the\nscreen.
Another text came.
'Muhahaha, does is get to you? If this makes you\nmad, you should remember not to ignore your\nlittle sister. Y the Thief'
'That girl's not a genius, she's an idiot...'
As usual, Asa is frozen to the spot.
It seems she's in deep shock that her precious\npanties had been stolen.
What can we say to console her at a time like\nthis...?
Totally powerless, all we could do was pat her on\nthe shoulder.
Still affected by this incident, we managed to\nfinish the cleaning in half a day.
'It's quite tidy now, isn't it?'
'Yeah, it looks like we'd be able to sleep here,\nif we had sleeping bags.'
We can't just throw things away, so it's still\nquite jumbled, but cleaner than before.
'Sniff, sniff...'
'C'mon, cheer up, Asa. If you're worried about\nyour panties, I'll help you choose some better\nones.'
'N-...No, that's not it. Well, I am worried about\nthem, I'm a bit sad that Aoi saw my panties...'
'I might not be able to become a bride now...'
What? Really?
Anyway, that's too much hassle to get involved\nwith, so I pretend not to hear, as I put down the\nphoto frame.
'...This should be OK here.'
I put the photo frame on the desk, which stands\nat about waist height.
I brought this from the dormitory, along with the\nvacuum cleaner.
'That's OK, isn't it? You can see it from\nanywhere in the room.'
'Yeah. I like it. I think it's like Amane is\nalways watching us.'
We can't let down our past selves... or Amane.
These are the feelings we've had up until now.
On that day, one thing ended, but it was also the\nstart of something new.
Asa seemed a bit down when she came over to take\na look at the picture of all of us.
She was the only one not there.
'Let's all take one together.'
'Huh?'
'A commemorative photo. Once our glider flies.'
'Yeah, not just once it's flown, let's take\nphotos regularly.'
'As a record of our activities.'
'Yeah, that sounds good. Something we can leave\nbehind for our successors, so they can see what\nkind of things we did.'
'Successors?'
'This is a club, isn't it? We'll leave it behind\nfor generations to come.'
'I see. I hadn't thought of that.'
'What? Even though we have a new member?'

In the same way that we inherited the glider from
Amane, I thought we'd leave something behind for
the ones who were looking up at the clouds, with
the same feelings that we had.
Maybe it's still too early to be thinking about\nthat.
But it was fun to think about that kind of\nfuture.
'I'm sorry, Y the Thief...'
'I won't ignore you ever again.'
'Now do you know how it feels to have something\nimportant taken from you?'
'Yes.'
'Muhahaha, if this makes you mad, you should be\nkinder to your little sister!'
'More importantly, I learned of the embarrassment\nof having a boy look at my panties.'
'Huh? A boy? Panties? That photo?'
'Aoi and the others were with me.'
'...The one of me wearing them?'
'Yes, the one of you wearing them. Aoi saw my\npanties.'
'EEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!'
Since moving our base of operations to the secret\nbase on Windmill Hill, our club activities were\ngetting more serious.
Until now, we'd been working 'underground', and\nwe couldn't achieve anything that stood out that\nmuch, so now, it was our chance to work hard.
The first thing for us to do was work on the\nrepairs to the damaged aircraft.
'Use the brush to push the air out of the glass\nmat, and paint the resin over it.'
'Like this...?'
'You're putting on too much, do it little by\nlittle.'
'This much...?'
'It's still too much. If the FRP has a high ratio\nof resin, the strength is reduced.'
'So, about this much?'
'That's not enough!'
'Ohh... It's difficult.'
In the corner of the dock, Kotori is teaching Asa\nthe process for making things from FRP.
In the same way as one year ago, when Ageha\ntaught Kotori, they were making a dish from FRP.
'Yes, like that. Now, try to do it as quickly as\nyou can.'
'As quickly as I can... Oh!'
'Woah! You spilt it!? It's spilling out, it's\nspilling out!'
'Oh no, what should I do...?'
Asa knocked over the bucket filled with resin.
'Hey, what are you doing?'
'Aaaargh! We can't use this anymore.'
'...I'm sorry.'
Asa seems disheartened as she apologies.
However, Ageha doesn't go easy on her.
'Do you understand? We only have a limited amount\nof materials. If we don't have enough, we can't\nmake the glider, can we?'
'It's good to learn the techniques step by step,\nbut we have to be careful with the materials and\ntools.'
'It felt like Ageha was saying 'If you\nunderstand, then that's alright.', then she came\nback over towards me.
Ageha and I were repairing the damaged parts of\nthe aircraft.
FRP repairs are carried out in much the same way\nas when joining the parts that been built\nseparately.
We attach the glass mat to the back of the\ndamaged parts, spread the resin, to laminate it.
Once it's dry, we sand it, then paint it again,\nand then it's finished. It's pretty easy.
The problem is that when we reinforce the damaged\nareas, the FRP becomes thicker, which increases\nthe weight.
Of course, it's a problem if it becomes heavy but\nin the case of a glider, the balance of the\naircraft might also get messed up.
'Are these the only places damaged on the right\nwing?'
'Yeah. Next, is the body.'
'Alright. Let's get this finished today.'
These are the cracks that we haven't been able to\nfix for a year.
We wanted to do it so we'd be able to fly again\nsoon.
'Sheesh... I messed up again.'
Asa let out a sigh as she cleaned up the resin\nthat she had spilt.

It was spilt on the floor, so it can't be used
again due to impurities being mixed in with it.
But, because they are using it to make a dish as
practice, it can still be used for that.
As Ageha said, there is a limit to our materials.\nSo, when we run out, we don't have the funds to\nbe able to replenish them easily.
'Push out the air... here, and here...'
'Haha...'
'Hmm? What is it, Kotori?'
'Nothing much, I just remembered something.'
'There was a time when I did the same thing\nyou're doing now.'
Kotori relaxed, closed her eyes, and started to\ntell a story about something.
The way she looked was just like a great actress\nlooking back on half of her lifetime.
'Whatever I did, it didn't go well, and I was\nworried that I was just slowing everyone down.'
'But the ones who changed me, were my\nirreplaceable friends...'
'Irreplaceable friends...?'
'Yes. Because of my bond with those friends, I\nwas able to change!'
'...That's enough. I can't take any more!'
Ageha threw down the brush she was using to\nspread the resin.
'I can't bear to listen to you telling those\nstories with such a serious look on your face!'
'Look at this, it's freaking me out so much, I'm\ngetting goose bumps!'
Next to her, I held onto by stomach as I broke\ninto a fit of laughter.
'Bwahahahahahaha!! Wh-...What is this? Don't make\nme laugh, I can't hold my hand still!!'
'I was being serious!!'
'Aaah! I can't take it!'
'Gyahahahaha!! Haa...haa... Hahaha!!'
'W-...Watch out, Asa. Sometimes she makes a\nreally serious face and says some hilarious\nthings!'
'Oh... Was that a joke just now?'
'It's not a joke!'
Kotori started throwing things at us in anger.
'Ow! Sorry, I'm just kidding, ouch!'
'Hey, you're gonna hit the glider! Ouch!'
'You idiots! Don't you have any sense of tact,\nyou morons! Go to hell!!'
'Sorry, I'm sorry! Well, I'm happy you feel that\nway though.'
'It's just that you need to have a sense of the\ntime, the place and the occasion, isn't that\nright, Ageha?'
'Yeah, I'm happy but just don't say things like\nthat when we're doing serious work.'
'See this? My hand was shaking and now it's\nbent!!'
'That's not my fault!! You've only got yourselves\nto blame!!'
Not knowing if we were joking or serious, Asa\ncouldn't keep up with it and just watched us.
'All of you are really close, aren't you?'
'There's nothing good about that! You heard them\njust now, right? I'm the only one who believed in\nfriendship!'
'We were just teasing you, that's all! We love\nyou, Kotori!'
'Our friendship will last forever!'
'I'm breaking off our friendship, you idiots!!'
Oh no, she's really sulking now.
If we leave it like this, it'll drag on for\nanother week.
'I'll buy you an ice cream later.'
'Hargen Darch Strawberry, OK?'
She turns her back to us as we tried the\nsoftly-softly approach to appease her. She goes\nback to teaching Asa about FRP.
'It's coming along nicely.'
'So something like this can become like that big\nglider?'
'That's right.'
'To see it flying on the wings that you've built\nyourself, is the best feeling.'
A fire was burning in Asa's eyes.
'...I'll give it my all!'
'Yeah, that's the spirit!'
The repairs to the glider were soon completed.
There were only cracks in a few places, and the\nrepair work itself was quite easy.
After that, we carried out a spot check of the\nwhole aircraft, and didn't find any problems.
With that, we'd reached a point whereby if we\ndecided to fly, we would be able to, but...
'It's time to start the big remodeling project!'
At Kotori, the leader's signal, Ageha laid out\nthe designs.
Asa stared at the detailed diagram.
'This is amazing. Did you draw this too?'
'No way!'
'This was drawn by Amane.'
'Amane? Oh, the one in the photo?'
'Yes. Because Amane's a genius. The real thing!'
Kotori intentionally said it in a way that Yoru,\nsipping instant coffee while sitting on a chair\nat the back of the room, would be able to hear.
Before, Yoru had stolen something important from\nAsa, and maybe she felt gratified by that, so now\nshe sometimes comes here with Asa.
Yoru didn't seem to be concerned as she ignored\nKotori.
Just like a cat who, with a nonchalant\nexpression, decides to take a nap, even when a\ndog is barking at her.
The teachers and some of the students have been\nmaking a fuss over her, saying she's a genius.\nBut, I've never seen her claim that herself.
'What kind of person is Amane?'
'She's on the borderline between a natural-born\nfool and a genius.'
'On the borderline of being a natural-born\nfool...?'
'She really is strange. She has no idea of just\nhow great she is, it seems.'
'She either has a complete lack of objectivity,\nor the way her brain is wired is just that\ndifferent to normal people...'
'She would often say 'That's because I'm\nstupid'.'
'Really? She seems very kind.'
'I think rather than saying she's kind, I'd say\nshe's more like a kid.'
'That's why she needed so much taking care of!'
She looks very pretty, she's tall, has a good\nfigure and is a very feminine girl.
But her eyes are like a little kid's, and it was\nlike she was looking at the world through a\nprism.
There was a mysterious feeling about her.
'These designs were made by Amane for her best\nfriend.'
'Best friend??'
'Yes. Our predecessor... or so she should be. But\nthe truth is, we don't know what sort of person\nshe is.'
'She's called Isuka, and she, along with Amane,\nrevived the Soaring Club but after that, she\nsuddenly left the school.'
'Isuka... Isuka...'
'Asa?'
'Ah... no... I just thought it was an unusual\nname.'
'Is that why you're going to make this?'
'That's one reason, but that's not all.'
'The mysterious clouds that you saw, we told you\nbefore how that's what we're aiming for, didn't\nwe?'
We've spoken many times about the last flight I\ntook with Amane.
'We've been thinking about several reasons why we\nfailed that time.'
'There are basically three problems.'
I explained them simply, so that Asa could\nunderstand.
The first is the lack of lift.

The glider we have now is extremely well
balanced, and because of all the flights we
performed, we made adjustments in the way it's
been built.
That is to say, it's an all-rounder.

On the other hand, it doesn't specialize in any
particular area, which might count as a negative
point, since it's been built for a specific
purpose.
The thing we need are wings that will allow us to\nfly high.
When there aren't many upward drafts, we have to\nreach a high altitude as quickly as we can, so we\nneed wings adapted for that.
The next thing we need is piloting skills.
We realized that it takes a lot of skill to find\nthe upward drafts in the limited time we have to\nreach the Morning Glory.
That's why I traveled to the airfield, and\nunderwent proper pilot training. A few days ago,\nI finally got my pilot's license.
Last of all, is the flight plan.
When the Morning Glory appears, completely\ndifferent weather patterns to normal occur over\nKazegaura.
This affects where the upward drafts will occur,\nwhat kind they'll be, and how high they'll be\nable to lift the glider.
Also, which winds we should ride.
For that, we needed to put together a plan.
'So that's how it is. Do you understand so far?'
'Yep!'
She gives a strong reply but it doesn't really\nlook like she understands.
Not much we can do about that, she's a new member\nwho hasn't even done any test flights yet.
'To put it simply, we're going to make wings that\ncan get a lot of lift to make it fly higher.'
'That's what these plans are for.'
Amane must have foreseen this when she drew these\nplans.
However, there was no way she could've made it by\nherself.
We would be the ones to build this glider, that\nalmost seemed like an illusion.
'Well then, let's get to work on it right away!'
We head to the dock, and the first thing is to\nmake the new wings.
The same way as before, it starts with us making\nthe shape from Styrofoam.
We already have experience of doing this, so we\ncan get to work without delay.
'Phew... So this is how you make it?'
'Don't just stand there acting all impressed,\ncome and help.'
'This heat-cutter is used to cut the Styrofoam.\nHere, try it.'
She's teaching Asa how to do it properly.
'Slowly, slowly...'
'That's it, like that... carefully...'
'Woah!'
'Hold it, where do you think you're cutting!?'
'Aoi, come and hold it down here!'
'Sure.'
'It's so spacious, so it's easy to work here.'
'Yeah. It's a little hot though.'
There's no air conditioning in the dock.
We were able to use the electric fan we'd brought\nwith us to keep cool.
While dripping with sweat, we become immersed in\nthe work.
'Look at you, sweating like that, with such\ndesperation on your faces, everyone's so\nhardworking, I don't understand it.'
Yoru, who was leaning against the wall, turned to\nleave the dock.
'Yoru, are you leaving?'
'...I'm just going to buy something to drink.\nIt's so hot in here, I feel like I'm gonna die.'
'Sis, do you need anything?'
'Umm... Yeah, soda.'
'How about the rest of you?'
'Huh?'
'Oh... oolong tea, please.'
'Um... Can I have cola?'
'Me too.'
'Soda, oolong tea, and two colas.'
With a straight face, Yoru left the dock.
We looked at each other curiously, but we didn't\nreally say anything, and went back to work.
There was still something we needed to do as part\nof the safe execution of the glider improvement\nproject.
That was...
Cutting the grass on the runway!
We gathered some people to help with the work on\na midsummer's Saturday afternoon, under the\nblazing hot sun.
About halfway through the work, Kotori and I went\nto greet the landowner at their home.
'It's so hot... I'm going to melt, Yoru.'
'So why don't you come over here and take a\nbreak? It's cool in the shade. There's juice\ntoo.'
'Uh... no, I'm OK.'
'C'mon, Asa, do your best! If we don't, we won't\nbe able to fly.'
I pushed Kotori's wheelchair back to where the\nothers, covered in sweat, were working.
'Welcome back.'
'Welcome back, you two. ...What's up?'
asked Asa, looking at Kotori's gloomy expression.
'I'm sorry, everyone.'
Everyone was puzzled by Kotori coming back with\nher held lowered in apology.
'What is it? Did something happen?'
'...We can't use the runway anymore.'
'Huh? Why not?'
Ageha, who was now even more puzzled, looked at\nme, who had accompanied Kotori.
'It's as Kotori says. They said we can't use it.'
The landowner is an old member of the Soaring\nClub, and last year, they had willingly let us\nuse the runway.
But this year, we can't use it.
'The truth is...'
Kotori told everyone the situation.
That person knew that the Soaring Club had lost\nit's status.
The school had requested that they not allow\nformer members of the Soaring Club to use the\nrunway.
The one who contacted them was Tobioka.
Because it doesn't count as club activities, if\nany problems occurred, they couldn't be held\nresponsible.
That's why they can't let us use it, even if they\nwanted to.
It's a natural decision.
It wasn't their fault at all, and they apologized\nover and over.
'Just how far will that guy go to stand in our\nway...?'
'He probably realizes that we are carrying out\nour activities in secret.'
He must already know that it was us who took the\nglider from the store room.
'I'm sorry, it's my fault. It's because of my\nbody being like this, that they were being extra\ncautious with me...'
'What? That's got nothing to do with it!'
'Hold it, why do you think that?'
Kotori was acutely aware of something in the\nlandowner's reaction.
There certainly was an element of that.
If something were to happen to someone disabled,\nlike Kotori, it's possible that it would become\nan even bigger problem.
Although the landowner didn't actually say\nanything like that, it seems that Tobioka-sensei\nhad made that implication.
'They didn't say it directly, but it seems that\nthe school had said something like that to them.'
'What the hell? That's so low...'
However, that's not the reason.
The real reason they refused is because the\nSoaring Club is treated as having been shut down.
'...So, does that mean we can't fly?'
'We don't have a runway, so there's nothing we\ncan do.'
'That's...'
Asa looked sadly at her hands that were covered\nin dirt from pulling up weeds.
'Why don't you look for another place?'
'It's no good. There are only a limited number of\nplaces which are flat enough and have enough\nspace.'
'What a bunch of idiots.'
Yoru, who was sitting in the shade listening to\nour conversation, spoke like she was irritated.
Kotori glared angrily at her.
'You're going to give up because of something\nlike that? You were so motivated until just now.'
'What's that supposed to mean? This has nothing\nto do with you.'
'Yes it does. We're letting you use that place,\nand you've involved my sister in all this too.'
'Well, if that's all you've got, you should just\ngive up right now.'
'Yoru, stop it.'
'I'm telling the truth, that's all.'
There's nothing mistaken in what Yoru is saying.
If we get depressed and give up because of\nsomething like this, it would have been better if\nwe'd never even started in the first place.
That's why no one has anything to say back to\nher.
'We won't give up. Isn't that right, Kotori?'
'Yeah, of course.'
Just as things where starting to go well, we were\nhit with a big 'counter-punch', which left us\nreeling.
But, we're not ones to lose heart at this sort of\nthing.
